review_title: Melatonin is combined with various ingredients that have a sleep-inducing effect to induce natural sleep.
review_text: I started taking melatonin with gummies, and have taken it in various forms such as capsules, tablets, quick-dissolving tablets, and liquid. I have it in all dosages: 3mg, 5mg, 7mg, and 10mg, and I choose and combine it depending on my condition that day. For me, the good thing about melatonin is that it doesn't have as strong an effect as sleeping pills, it helps me fall asleep naturally, and I wake up refreshed without feeling sluggish or sleepy. (I think this depends on the compatibility, so some people may feel that way...) Sleeping pills don't leave me feeling refreshed, so on days when I feel a little sleepy, I can sometimes fall asleep with just melatonin. Now, in addition to melatonin, this supplement contains ingredients and herbs that have a tranquilizing effect, such as L-theanine, hop extract, passionflower, chamomile, and lemon balm, which I feel enhance the effect of falling asleep. However, the amount of melatonin at 3mg seems too weak for me. I don't get very sleepy unless I take this with 3mg of melatonin alone or combine it with half a tablet of Belsomra prescribed by my psychiatrist. If you don't have as severe a sleep disorder as I do, I think this alone will help you fall asleep.
the ingredients are good, the size is large, but you can swallow it. the effect is there, but maybe I expected more. falls asleep not immediately after use, but definitely better than without them

Ternana officinalis This herb in the mint family is used to promote sleep through relaxation. Chamomile Chamomile, similar to the daisy, is known for its calming effect and use in herbal teas. Passionflower This plant is traditionally used to promote sleep, and has been harvested as a medicine for centuries. L-80 Soothing Green Tea is rich in this amino acid, which has a gentle relaxing effect. Hops This floral group helps increase alpha waves in the brain, which speeds up the onset of sleep. Melatonin This vital hormone, naturally secreted by the pituitary gland, helps regulate sleep patterns. Narine This perennial herb is used around the world to promote relaxation and help calm the mind.

It contains herbs with the potential to improve sleep quality, along with theanine and melatonin. You can take a lot of herbs with one grain. Especially valerian and lemon balm are abundant. One tablet contains 100mg of theanine, which is a sufficient amount. One tablet contains 1.5 mg of melatonin. I don't think this is a lot. The standard amount is 2 capsules per time, but if I were you, I would add 1 capsule of this supplement to the single melatonin supplement to aim for a deeper sleep. I use it as the main support role, not the main sleep supplement.
